John,
Just wanted to make sure everything went o.k.
I neglected to remind you
again when we talked today about obtaining the Certificate of Occupancy, so I
hope that the Seller delivered it as she had promised.
If not let me know so
that we can find an immediate solution.
The only other things I would
caution you on at this point would be as follows:
1)
Make sure to put together your list of warranty repairs prior to 30 days
from today's date and to deliver same to the Seller within such time period
(per the warranty agreement).
2)
Make sure to follow up with the Seller about the fireplace.
She is
supposed to finish that work within 60 days from today's date.
3)
Make sure to compare your title policy, when it comes in the mail, to the
marked Title Commitment you received today.
There shouldn't be anything in
the policy that is not in the Title Commitment.
When you get the policy, you
can send a copy to me and I will be glad to confirm this for you.
4)
You should get the recorded deed in the mail from the title company or
the county clerk.
If you do not receive it within 30 days, call the title
company and ask that they find it or obtain a certified copy for you.
If there is anything you need, just let me know.
Ron I. Erlichman Bracewell & Patterson, L.L.P. 711 Louisiana, Suite 2900 Houston, Texas

This note is to inform you that, effective January 3, 2002, PIRA Energy Group will terminate delivery of the Energy Retainer Services, which we have been providing Enron for almost a decade.

Planning to attend the Olympics in Sydney, Australia?
Here is a networking opportunity for our international IDRC visitors to
experience some warm Aussie hospitality.
The Sydney Chapter would love to offer our international IDRC members an
opportunity to combine the Olympics with a real Aussie Bush Barbeque in one
of our National Parks close to Sydney.
The Chapter has set aside Thursday, 14 September 2000 for an IDRC
International "Wine & Wisdom" event in the form of a Bush BBQ.
The time is
4:00 - 6:00 pm for a BBQ, a little informal information sharing, and some
warm Aussie hospitality.
Just let us know who you are, how we can contact you, your particular social
or business interest, and we will be in touch with more detail.
It's then up
to you!
Contact John Fox, IDRC Australia Regional Director, tel (612) 9977 0732,
email: john.fox@idrc.org
Regards,
Bruce Richards Australia Regional Council Chair
John Fox Australia Regional Director
